noun.description: A student or trainee who works, sometimes without pay, at a trade or occupation in order to gain work experience.

verb.description: Confine (someone) as a prisoner, especially for political or military reasons.
examples: the family were interned for the duration of the war as enemy aliens

origin: Early 16th century (as an adjective in the sense internal): from French interne (adjective), interner (verb), from Latin internus inward, internal. Current senses date from the 19th century.
